intro: Perityle warnockii, commonly known as the Warnock's perityle, is a rare flowering plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in woodland areas. Its botanical features include a basal rosette of leaves and a flowering stem that produces white to pale yellow flowers. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is protected in several states.
